intro: Cereus pentlandii var. longispinus, commonly known as the long-spined night blooming cereus, is a cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems covered in white, spiny tubercles. The plant produces large, fragrant, white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its striking appearance and unique blooming habit make it a popular choice for desert gardens and indoor cultivation.
